creator: gtalvola@nameconnector.com
text:
I built a release version of Apache 2.0.44 with OpenSSL 0.9.7 using Visual C++
6.0.  Then I edited httpd.conf to enable mod_ssl, copied a server.key and
server.crt into the right places, and started Apache with "apache -D SSL".  If I
make one or more SSL requests then stop Apache with Ctrl-C, after a few seconds
a message box pops up that says:

Apache.exe - Application Error
The instruction at "0x77f6ce4c" referenced memory at "0x00000010".  The memory
could not be "written".

After about 10 more seconds, both Apache processes exit, but the message box
stays on the screen until I click OK or Cancel.

This didn't happen with Apache 2.0.43 with the same version of OpenSSL.

creator: towerofpower@operamail.com
text:
Check bug 17055, a 'quick fix' is to set loglevel in httpd.conf to above warn, 
the error does not happen.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 20462 ***
creator: jorton@redhat.com
